intro: Homalium trichostemon, commonly known as the white-flowered evergreen. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Asia. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. The fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that contains several seeds.
